Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, with a few issues
Reviews.Author: Lawrence D. Cohen
Reviews.Content: Overall, I think this is an excellent TV, but it has issues which may or may not be a problem for you.1) The picture is excellent - very clear picture, accurate color.  I have two other smaller HD TVs that are 720p, and you can see the difference compared to them.2) The stand doesn't move.  The TV sits vertically, and you can't lean it or swivel left to right.  This isn't a problem for me, but I mention it in case it might bother some people.3) The TV comes with instructions regarding set-up, but doesn't really come with an owners manual.  I think this is a point against Toshiba, but it's not that big an issue, since you can download the PDF from Toshiba's web site for free.  You'll need the manual if you want to know what the various picture size settings are, like "native" or "full" or "TheaterWide 1", etc.4) The sound is not good, it's rather tinny.  My smaller TVs have much better sound.  I think they should have done better here, but if you're buying a 46" TV, you're probably hooking it up to some kind of stereo/sound system.  My stereo has good sound, so I'm not too concerned with the TV's own sound.  If you're not planning to connect this to some kind of sound system, you'll be disappointed with the sound.5) The connections in the back for audio-out include an optical/digital output (little square plug), and an analog output(RCA plugs).  Believe it or not, having analog sound output was a major selling point for me.  When I say I have a stereo, I mean just that.  I don't have a more modern Dolby 5.1 system.  I may get one eventually, but for now I want to hook the TV up to an old-fashioned stereo, which does not have optical connections.  That means I need a TV with RCA plug connectors for sound output.  Other TVs, like a SONY model that I looked at, only have the optical/digital output, so I can't hook them up.  Look out for this if you have an old stereo.6) It's an LED, so it's very thin, like less than 2 inches thick.  It's no big deal for one person to lift it.7) The price here at Amazon is $100 less than most other places are selling it for.I'm very happy with the TV.  The only thing that may have disappointed me is the sound, but my stereo takes care of that.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the price
Reviews.Author: Randolfio
Reviews.Content: I got this TV from Fry's for an unbeatable price - $699. The whole idea behind this thing is to give you a decent LED picture at a low price point without the frills. Sound? Yep, sucks. "Smart" internet features? Not here. But the picture is great, and I run it through my home theater system for sound. And if you're spending over $600 for a TV, why wouldn't you? I just don't understand people complaining about the sound on flat TVs. It's like buying an iPod and then complaining that the sound coming out of the built-in one inch speaker isn't good. That's not what they're made to do... You have to plug it into decent headphones or a receiver to make it sound like it should.Anyway, this TV does exactly what I expected it to and more. It's certainly not top of the line, but it has exceeded my expectations. It is a low-power consumption LED with great picture. Aside from the sound and lack of Smart TV features (which I knew about before buying) the only negative I have found about this thing is that you can see the light from the LEDs coming from the corners when the screen is pitch black. I don't notice it when there's anything on the screen, even with black bars in letterbox, but it's there on a completely black screen. Doesn't bother me in the slightest though.I highly recommend this TV if you can get it at the right price and don't expect more than what it is designed to do.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture -- Very Poor Sound
Reviews.Author: Goldrush
Reviews.Content: Just got it from Fry's for $599.  Very nice unit -- beautiful design, great picture, but the sound is really bad.  There is no dynamic range, and it sounds exceptionally flat -- tinny, unnatural sound.  While another reviewer says that's what to expect from a flat screen, my experience indicates that's not true, as I have 7 other flat screens (mostly Sony and Samsung), and nothing sounds as bad as this.  Since I only paid $599, I'm good with this purchase, but I'm wondering what Toshiba was thinking when they installed a 29 cent speaker in this unit -- I may call them and ask them.  BTW, when the unit was in my cart at Fry's, I checked the reviews on my iPhone and read about the sound issue, but I thought, how bad can it be?  I found out -- it's pretty bad. Thinking of adding a sound bar -- Zvox makes a nice one for about $250.

Reviews.Title: This is a Great TV !!!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I bought this Toshiba for a friend of mine and let me tell you......the picture is awesome !!! For those that complain about the sound from these newer flat panels.....what do you expect ???This set is like 1.3 inches deep !!! Most people will be hooking up a sound bar or their home theater system. The picture in HD is amazing...even from the crappy Charter Cable System !!! Didn't buy from here but the value per inch for this set is incredible !!!

Reviews.Title: My NEW new tv
Reviews.Author: Ma Jah
Reviews.Content: After a little confusion with the television I ordered versus what I received, Amazon more than made up for their error.  I am very happy with my television!  It actually took me a bit of getting used to because the picture is so crisp, it seemed to have an almost 3-D look about it.  It's awesome!  It's my first Toshiba (although my son has one) and, so far, I am very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this TV!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Lewis
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV in December of 2011. The first thing you notice is the audio, or lack thereof. This tv is unwatchable using just the internal speakers. The picture quality WAS great. If you noticed my use of past tense it's because the tv won't turn on now. It is 2 months past the year warranty, so Toshiba is of very little help. They offered to trouble shoot via telephone for $45, and nothing else. This is my first review written for Amazon, induced by frustration. Heed my warning or you'll be out $900 bucks waiting to see how much your local tv repairman will charge.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba: a swing & a miss in customer relations
Reviews.Author: two-oaks4
Reviews.Content: Good & bad about this product ... but the bad greatly outweighs the good. First the good: the 46SL412U HAD a very good picture. Now the bad: this TV's main module went bad (no video) after we owned it for less than 16 months.  So it was less than 4 months out of warranty. Toshiba's customer relations would do absolutely nothing about this.  Apparently keeping customers is not a priority for Toshiba.  So they are leaving us two undesirable choices: we either pay our local TV repairman $300 to get this TV fixed ... or we scrap it & shell out at least $500 for a new TV.  Neither are good choices huh?  Nobody in my family will buy another Toshiba product as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: suitanim1
Reviews.Content: You know you're talking about a great product when the main complaints are that the remote isn't back-lit and the speakers suck. Who in this day and age would purchase a 46" LED HDTV and run the sound through the native speakers anyway? The picture quality was incredible right out-of-the-box, and after calibration it was breathtaking. This is an astounding value for under $800, and stands up to my friends LED which he paid a whopping 50% more for. I'm pleased with the quantity of inputs, it was easy to set-up my surround sound, easy to calibrate, and I found everything fairly intuitive. My only complaint is a bit of "screen door effect" during sports, but that's actually my fault for opting for the 120 Hz instead of spending a few more sheckles on the 240.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, sounds is tinney
Reviews.Author: lions
Reviews.Content: After much review and searching we picked the toshiba 46sl412u quality of picture is great the speakers are tinney you need a good sound system, we looked at sound bars but for the money we bought the bose cinnema with sub woofer  and two speakers what a sound, there are allot to tv with wifi but we chose one without. Bought before Christmas. We have a very bright room and side angles to watch shows and videos are great. Could have more of a jack pack another set would be nice. Would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Clark "geb"
Reviews.Content: I've got four Toshibas now and every one has performed flawlessly. I've got two wall-mounted and two on stands. I do recommend them.

Reviews.Title: really good but
Reviews.Author: adam
Reviews.Content: the only thing i would say is bad about this TV is the sound is really bad quality but as big as the TV is you should buy a surround sound anyways

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: A. Purvis "chinsbob"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV at Best Buy for a really good price.  I'm extremely pleased with it.  Picture quality is excellent, sound quality is excellent.  Menu is easy to navigate and has many modes and features.  I just brought it home yesterday so can't speak to longevity or consistency of performance over time, but right out of the box  I think I made an excellent choice.The only thing wrong so far is that there was no owner's manual in the box.  but I downloaded off the Toshiba website so no big.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba LED TV
Reviews.Author: Murali Kolli
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV a month back so far, we are happy with the TV.  Picture quality is good and sharp.  Easy to operate. Sound quality didn't meet our expectations.  I would certainly recommend to others based on the value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: TV died on me after 18 months
Reviews.Author: HARRY B BRACEY IV
Reviews.Content: It had a great picture and I was happy with it, but I'm not happy that it won't power up now, and it's out of warranty.  Buyer beware, Toshiba expects you to buy a new TV every 1-2 years, evidently.  I know this could happen with any TV, but I've been online reading horror stories of others having similar problems.

Reviews.Title: Beyond Poor
Reviews.Author: Larz
Reviews.Content: Was initially happy with this TV. Great pic and ok sound. Now after owning it for 2 yrs. Any color red constantly jumps in the pic and there is an EXTREMELY annoying high pitched squeal coming from the TV....all......the....time!I will NEVER buy a Toshiba TV again.

Reviews.Title: Why buy new
Reviews.Author: Devin
Reviews.Content: This referbished discontinued model is just what i needed to match an existing TV at my clients office.  Works great.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: km
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing! I got this product for an amazing price compared to the 1100 bucks that it usually sells for! The picture quality is great, the remote works, and it has fancy motion sensative buttons! Truly amazing! My only complaint would be the sound, but I think I can live with it, because it's not too horrible. Besides, I plan on getting surround sound soon anyway. Other than that, an amazing product for an amazing price! It came very quickly, and the people who delivered it were extremly nice and considerate! After looking for good but cheaper tvs for around this size, for an entire year, I determined it would be the best buy! I was right! I would totatly buy this TV again!

Reviews.Title: Francisco L. Saprissa
Reviews.Author: Francisco L.Saprissa "Paco"
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this TV Toshiba LED PRICESMART Costa Rica with a very good price, screen size and picture is excellent too, with good brightness, colors and HD, the sound that all commentators dare not crticar neither more nor less a reference audio is offered, and you want something better than an AV system acquires heat at least 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound chanels recommend the Onkyo, Yamaha or Pioneer easy to install, also do not offer someone criticizes the manual, but in the TV settings is quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Know what you're getting
Reviews.Author: BigPersia
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing, and it's a great value - just make sure you are running your audio through a sound system.Upgraded from a normal 42' LCD TV - I use this primarily as a monitor for my PC and have run into some minor issue with mouse lag and gaming lag, I don't think the processor on this TV is very strong.Played around with the settings, figured out that if I have the scaling processing done by the computer, and if I set the TV to "Game Mode" I can almost eliminate mouse lag.(Returned the TV - the input lag was just too much to bear - both for my xbox 360 and my PC)

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: jrad22
Reviews.Content: I was tempted by the low price of this model, but it's picture was terrible. Playback could seem choppy at times and the default settings were awful. I only kept it for a couple of weeks before exchanging it for a Samsung that was only a little more money. I would recommend staying away from this model. I know its an LED TV, i.e. thinner etc., but the speakers are a lot worse than other models.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA 46SL412U LED A GREAT VALUE FROM AMAZON!
Reviews.Author: HAPPYWOLF "DISCOJAB"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba 46SL412U 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED-LCD HDTV, BlackI SIMPLY LOVE TOSHIBA PRODUCTS AND AMAZON.COM HAS THE BEST PRICE FOR THIS LED FLAT SCREEN! THESE ARE THE FEATURES I LOVE ABOUT THIS NEW HDTV: THE DESIGN FOR THIS SET IS REALLY SLIM, AND I MEAN SLIMMER THAN MY OTHER TOSHIBA LCD. THE MOUNTING BASE IS EASY TO ASSEMBLE. ONCE I HAD IT CONNECTED TO MY BLU-RAY PLAYER & DIGITAL RECEIVER & TURNED IT ON, I WAS ABLE TO NAVIGATE THE VERY USER FRIENDLY ON-SCREEN MENUS TO SET THE PICTURE, COLOR & SOUND TO MY PREFERENCES & I SIMPLY LOVE THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE OF THE SET. THE COLORS & PICTURE DEFINITION ARE BEAUTIFUL SPECIALLY WHEN WATCHING BLU-RAY MOVIES & THE HOOK-UP TO MY ONKYO DIGITAL STEREO EQUIPMENT DELIVERS GREAT SOUND! MY ONLY DISLIKES WITH THIS SET ARE: WHY ARE THERE PHANTOM SHADOWS AT THE CORNERS OF THE  SCREEN SPECIALLY WHEN WATCHING LETTERBOXED MOVIES, I MEAN IT'S ANNOYING! YOU DO NOT SEE THESE SHADOWS WHEN WATCHING FULL SCREEN. ALSO THE SOUND FROM THE SET SPEAKERS IS NOTHING TO WRITE HOME ABOUT - WEAK & FLAT EVEN WHEN THE BASS ON THE SET IS SET AT MAX. ALSO THE PICTURE DEFINITION IS NOT MUCH DIFFERENT THAN MY OLDER LCD SET. TOSHIBA ENGINEERS NEED TO GO BACK TO THE DRAFTING BOARD TO IMPROVE SOME OF THESE FEATURES! OTHER THAN THAT I LOVE THE OVERALL PERFORMANCE OF THIS NEW HDTV SET & I REALLY HOPE FOR YEARS OF ENJOYMENT FROM MY NEW INVESTMENT!!

Reviews.Title: Lousy Sound!
Reviews.Author: Goybabe
Reviews.Content: Beware this stuffed turkey! We had a 46 inch Mitsubishi in our bedroom, and thought it was the best ever. For many years, (30 years) we've bought nothing but Mitsubishis, which seemed to die almost uniformly at the ten-year mark, and I felt that more than fair for ten years of the best TV around. We were even unconvinced that shelling out more for a Sony was worth it.Well, that was then and this is now. Our living room Mits just died after 2 years, a DLP whose projection system fell apart and started showing broken pixels like pieces of rice all over the screen. The company offered to give us another one for an unbelievable eight hundred dollars, and it had to be another DLP, a system we'd clearly seen was inferior. We dumped it, and had to pay for the privilege since the trash company won't take TVs anymore, and bought a new one. Next, within four weeks in fact, our bedroom 46 inch Mits, not a DLP but the far superior LED type, fell apart at 14 months, with thick black lines appearing on either side and other problems.The difference being that, though we don't normally, we had cash then, and so we also bought the all-you-can-get coverage warranty from Fry's. We were assured that should it fail, it would be replaced with a product of equal or superior quality. Right.We've spent three months trying to get Fry's to honor their warranty. Constant promises not delivered, phone calls not returned, all the usual garbage. Today, they made it clear that we would not be getting another Mitz, and they stuck us with this Toshiba piece of you-know-what.Okay, the picture's not bad. Let's face it - the picture's not bad on all the new HD tvs, especially if you're not looking at one right next to another. But the sound! It's unbelievable. I swear, I have an AM-FM emergency radio in my kitchen cabinet four-inches long that has better sound. We were both just floored. So now, we either have to box the thing back up (while my husband is on chemo, incidentally) and return it and start all over, or we have to shell out for a six-hundred dollar set of special TV speakers, that will also mean ANOTHER remote (with the DVD we already have two.) We like keeping things simpler in the bedroom. This is hardly a replacement, although, seeing the price on Amazon, I know why they shafted us with it.If you already have a great TV-stereo system, go for it. If not, avoid it like the plague.

ProductInfo.Features:
1080p Resolution: See colors and details like you never have before! Enjoy HD picture quality with 1080p Full HD.
ClearFrame 120Hz: Using advanced computer processing, ClearFrame 120Hz improves picture clarity and reduces motion blur
USB Connection: Easily connect to your favorite tunes and photos, create slideshows, or listen to your personal playlists with this feature.
3 HDMI-CEC: Easily connect to high-definition video, and amazingly immersive surround sound in one cable.
ClearFrame 120Hz: Action packed content has never looked better! Using advanced computer processing,
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 46SL412U 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LED-LCD HDTV, Black
